ApplicationParser is used to make new LApplications.

Method Detail

makeNewApplication

public static LApplication makeNewApplication(java.lang.String applicationBody)
                                       throws java.lang.Exception
The method makeANewApplication() parses a String given to it, into an LApplication.

All aplications have a procedure part and zero or more arguments. Both the procedure part and each argument have to be parsed, and then combined together to form an application.

The procedure can be a Lambda-expression, a Cond-expression, an ID or another Application.

The arguments can be any other expression. COND and LAMBDA, however, cannot be given as arguments to a procedure, because they are Special Forms that do not have a first-class-citizen rights.

Parameters:
applicationBody - The String representation of an application
Returns:
Returns a new LApplication that matches the semantic of the String representation.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - An Exception is thrown if either the procedure part is not of proper type or if, for some reason, one of the parts cannot be parsed into proper SkeletonLisp expressions
